bibl.title: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Philip Showalter Hench, October 3, 1952

div1.p: Nogueira sends Hench photographs of Building No. 1. The dedication of Camp Lazear will be on December 3, 1952, and he is going to send out the invitations soon. Nogueira wants Hench to attend the Science Academy Session following the dedication, which will be dedicated solely to the work of the Yellow Fever Commission, and for which he will be the principal speaker. He promises to save some of the original wood from Building No. 1 for Hench.

div1.head: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Philip Showalter Hench, October 3, 1952
div1.opener:
DR. PEDRO NOGUEIRA
MEDICO CIRUJANO
MARTI 219, MARIANAO
TELEFONO: B0-7577
Marianao Octubre 3 de 1952
Dr Philip Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
U.S.A.
Dear Philip:
div1.p:
Embracing that our good friend Mr Hess was going to
New York, I gave him an envelope with photos of the Camp, as well
as, perpendicular air views I had on hand, for you to send them by
air mail at Rochester, The tangencial views, have not been able to
get yet why through the bad storm overhear but I hope to have them
inside a few days.- Enclosed other photos stayed here.

On the other hand I am painting the little house which is through
and soon I will take some photos to send you right away. The park
is still in construction, although the rain has kept back some of
the work. Maybe you read about the storm we had 24th last month;
but it crossed on the middle of the country.

I am sending the invitations to the persons that you named,
after I will send you the program 3er December complete, to each
one; but from now I inform you, the Camp act will be at 10.00 A.M.
Same day you have a turn on the program 8 to 10 minutes. I pray
Philip you send me that speech some days before to be able to trans-
late it to spanish, to have time to send to the newspaper copies
to come out that very evening and at the same time in the next day
papers. I will get your room on National Hotel for 2nd and 3erd,
but I would like to know if you are along or with Mary; and I hope
that you will stay here till 4th morning, to attend the Science Aca
demy Session on the 3rd night, which I will be the principal speker
dedicating almost the whole to the Yellow Fever Commission. (Don-t
forget your Condecoration Finlay Medals when you coming).-

Beside that very night the Condecorations will be given to the
persons appointed with Finlay Order during this year. To that effect
I have noted the names you send me, and wish to inform you, that
Order, can be given to every one, who have done something for the
good of humanity, if not on Public Health or other branch of Medi-
cine. What the Council agrees, I will inform you later.- I have
plenty wood left from the Caseta and will have them prepared for
you and every one, who wishes to keep something of the same, like
souvenir.

Philip can I get through you, some actual photos of Truby, Han-
berry, Cooke and Lambert?.- Philip, write me often, on relation w
with all this, why I want the act to be a true memory of those bra-
ve men, who on this Marianao City wrote, the most wonderful page of
human love.
Write early and till next week:
div1.closer:
Pedro. NOTE.- Can you send inmediatly
the Lambert adress?
